state_summary: Justin Wenig, founder of Starbridge, shares his experience of starting a company that aimed to modernize how government and education worked. He highlights the challenges faced by startups trying to sell to the public sector, including fragmented data and bureaucracy. Starbridge, which helps business sales teams monitor opportunities in the public sector, has raised $42 million in Series A funding led by Craft Ventures.
evidence: Justin Wenig remembers his days at Y Combinator in 2019
He sold Coursedog in 2021 for nine figures to JMI Equity and remains on the board
Starbridge announced a $42 million Series A led by David Sacks' firm Craft Ventures
The company has raised $52 million to date, after previously raising a $10 million seed
Starbridge plans to launch 'Starbridge integrated experience', so users do not have to always go to the Starbridge platform to use its technology
keywords: Startup, Public Sector, Government, Education, Data Fragmentation, Bureaucracy, Funding, AI Era

metadata.investor_name: David Sacks' firm Craft Ventures, Owl Ventures, Commonweal Ventures, Autotech Ventures
